intro: Odontarrhena albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered odontarrhena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Odontarrhena albiflora is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
